comment._content: The Stevenson road, built by the African Lakes Corporation in 1883, was intended to link Lake Nyasa to Lake Tanganyika and the stations of the London Missionary Society in the area.  Beginning at Karonga in Nyasaland it ended at Mpulungu on Lake Tanganyika.  It was used to transport a LMS steamer to Lake Tanganyika in 1885. The Tanzania/Zambia border was laid out more or less parallel to the road, on the German side.
